prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to deploy edge runtimes using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Deploying Edge Runtimes using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide provides a step-by-step process on how to deploy edge runtimes using FastAPI, an efficient and flexible web framework for building APIs in Python 3.12+.
key_points: Understanding the prerequisites: Familiarity with Python 3.12+, FastAPI, and a containerization platform like Docker
Defining APIs and endpoints for edge runtime deployment
Setting up a Dockerfile for the FastAPI app
Building and running the Docker image locally
Deploying the Docker image to an edge runtime platform (e.g., AWS IoT Greengrass, Azure IoT Edge)
Testing the deployed edge runtime in a simulated or real-world environment

code_examples.code:
FROM python:3.12
WORKDIR /app
COPY . /app
RUN pip install fastapi uvicorn gunicorn
CMD ["uvicorn", "main:app", "--host", "0.0.0.0", "--port", "8080"]

version_notes: This guide is specifically tailored for Python 3.12+, but it can be adapted to work with previous versions by changing the base Docker image accordingly
FastAPI version 0.75 or higher is recommended for this guide
caveats: Edge runtime deployments may require additional configurations depending on the platform used
Ensure that you have properly secured your API and edge runtime by implementing authentication and authorization measures
